content.description:
You might feel spanked after hopping on this route!  Start with a hard, crimpy boulder problem crux to reach the right-trending seam.  Don't relax once you've gotten through this crux; continue on pumpy climbing and big moves following the seam until it's possible to move straight up through the bulge.  Fight the pump to the anchors!

Stick clipping the first bolt is highly recommended.
content.location: Climb the obvious black streak on the left side of Hurricane Wall, just to the right of the big roof that you walk under.

climbs.name: Monkey Dance
climbs.fa: S. Ornowski, T. Perkins, B. D'Antonio

content.description: Climb broken rock up to the left side of the smooth face.  Traverse left and then up through some balancy moves before reaching the anchor.
content.location: This is the first route on Hurricane Wall.  It starts before you turn the corner to the steeper routes on the main face.

content.description:
Climb up blocky terrain features to a shared last bolt and anchor with

Hot Wing

.
content.location:
This is the right-most route on Hurricane Wall, around the corner from

Foreplay

.

content.description: Climb up a  steep slab into a right-facing corner under the roof.  Escape this roof to the left and mantle up to easier climbing above.
content.protection: 6 bolts to anchor. The last bolt is shared with Little Caesar.
content.location:
It is on the far right of Hurricane Wall, around the corner from

Foreplay

.  This route shares the last bolt and anchor with the 10a to the right.

content.description: This route is a fun jug haul up some steep rock to a crimpy crux above the 3rd bolt. Yard and swing your way up and left (avoiding the guano where you can) through 3 bolts before pulling onto the short slab using crimps (crux). A horizontal break gives up more jugs and cool laybacks to the anchor.
content.location: It is located in the middle of Hurricane Wall, just to the right of Spanked by a Monkey.

content.description: Climb up some immediately powerful moves past 2 bolts to get established beneath the steep head wall. Navigate up on jugs through a tricky crux which gives way to huge jugs and the anchor.
content.location: It is on the right side of Hurricane Wall just past the main, steep section.  Scramble up a bit to a good belay ledge.

content.description:
This is one of the steepest routes on the Pass!  A HARD boulder problem start with a series of tension-y slaps from sloper to sloper, with a crimp or two thrown in, past the first 3 bolts finally gets you to a good jug shake below bolt 4.  Move up into the alcove to another good rest and milk it for as long as possible, because the final roof and headwall is packed full of big pulls and dynamic moves to a final heartbreaking redpoint crux!

This route stays with you from beginning to end and the long hump up here is worth it just to do this route if nothing else.  It is recommended to stick clip the first bolt.
content.location:
It is right in the middle of Hurricane Wall, just to the left of

Foreplay

.  Start under a roof with the first 2 bolts close together.
